clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of a Modified Obturator Nerve Block Technique

oversight_info.authority: Austria: Federal Office for Safety in Health Care

brief_summary.textblock: Efficacy of a modified obturator nerve block technique by using only a single morphological landmark, a double-blinded randomised pilot study.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: pre operative, 30 minutes before start surgery
primary_outcome.description: Adductor muscle strength is measured with a sphygmomanometer. Patients are instructed to squeeze a blod pressure cuff, already inflated to 40 mm Hg, between their extended knees. The maximal sustained pressure is taken as the baseline adductor strength.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists 1-3, older than 18 y, cooperative patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- infection, neuromuscular deficits of the lower extremities,pregnancy, neurologic disease

reference.citation: Feigl GC, Ulz H, Pixner T, Dolcet C, Likar R, Sandner-Kiesling A. Anatomical investigation of a new vertical obturator nerve block technique. Ann Anat. 2013 Jan;195(1):82-7. doi: 10.1016/j.aanat.2012.05.008. Epub 2012 Aug 10.
